In a flash, more than a dozen flags were flying behind the right-wing front: on the blood-red flags, a mighty army was baring its fangs and claws!

"It's the Bloody Lion Tribe!" The squad leaders heard the horn, turned around and gave orders: "Brothers, attack! Attack at all costs!"

The last four rows, which originally still had some strength left (the squad formation was eight rows and eight columns, with a total of 64 people), pressed forward at the same time, causing the pressure on the opposing Mepians to increase sharply.

Both the Mepiae and the Brutti learned a lesson from their wars against the Greeks: in a field battle, to stop the squeeze attack of the heavily armed and closely arranged Greek phalanx, one must deploy more warriors than the enemy. The Mepiae left wing had 500 men, which was a quarter more than the Poseidon right wing, which had less than 2,000 men.

Hilo adopted the advanced tactics of step-by-step attack, hoping to take advantage of the time difference and use his strongest team to defeat the opponent first, thus gaining a local advantage. Although Mepiah had taken precautions, the oblique line formed by Poseidon's right wing undoubtedly lengthened the battle line, forcing Mepiah's left wing to also lengthen the battle line in order to prevent flank attacks, hoping to overlap with Poseidon's right wing, thus making Mepiah's left wing formation thin.

Although the Poseidon right wing was also weak, and there were even gaps between the small squares, the Poseidon soldiers were well-equipped and well-trained, and had long been accustomed to fighting in small squares. They could hold out for a long time in the face of flank attacks. The already loose formation on the left wing of Mephia became even looser.

Poseidon intensified his attack, and the casualties of the Mepeans began to increase.

…

Meppia Middle Road.

Originally, Hammock hoped to concentrate his forces to defeat the enemy's center in one fell swoop. However, he did not expect that the weak slaves in the eyes of the soldiers a few days ago could actually fight against his powerful soldiers.

There are many reasons for this: First, the two days of expedited training gave the slaves a preliminary understanding of teamwork. Secito and the slave soldiers who served as squad leaders also fully understood their own soldiers, and the two merged.

Secondly, Hilo urgently equipped the slaves with wooden shields picked up on the battlefield and obtained from Tusim, giving them a certain degree of defensive capabilities. After experiencing the attack and defense of the camp, these slaves were no longer afraid of killing. These slaves were purchased by the citizens of Poseidia because they were physically strong and capable. Now with Hilo's promise, their explosive combat power should not be underestimated.

Furthermore, although the Brutti had broken away from their left, their right side was protected by Poseidon's soldiers. When the battle began, because Poseidon's right wing was diagonal, Heracles' phalanx squad and the other two squads faced not the left wing of Meppia, but the flank of Meppia's center, which involved a lot of Meppia's center troops...

As these factors accumulated one after another, the slaves' fighting power had completely changed compared to three days ago, but Hammok still looked at them with the old eyes and kept urging the warriors to attack fiercely.

The slave phalanx did not move at all, but instead consumed a lot of the physical strength of the Mepiah soldiers.

The slave phalanx in the middle could not attack, but the left wing of Mepiah began to retreat under the fierce attack of the well-equipped Poseidon soldiers. The diagonal line gradually compressed inward to form a bow shape, and the entire left wing front was shaky.

Shiloh was very calm at this moment, he firmly believed that the moment of victory for the right wing would come soon!

"My King, look!!" Larka's shout woke up Shilo who was just about to close his eyes and relieve stress.

He was surprised to see the Mepiah tribe members who were standing in the back and cheering for the Mepiah warriors rushing towards the left wing of Mepiah like a swarm of bees...

"What does this mean? What does this mean?! Do a group of old men, women and children want to stop the attack of Poseidon's warriors? Do they really think I will be so kind as not to attack them?!" Shiloh was furious. The most hated thing on the battlefield is accidents, and Shiloh has encountered accidents one after another since the battle began, making it impossible for him to remain calm.

Of course, Hilo's anger could not scare away the brave old men and women of Mepiah who rushed forward. They used their thin chests to hold back the retreating bodies of the warriors, shouted their names anxiously, and stabbed their enemies with spears through the gaps.

The women and children of Mepiah were never gentle and docile. The pirates in the Adriatic Sea, with their advanced navigation skills, could easily avoid the heavily guarded Mepiah villages, land in places with weak defenses, attack the defenseless tribes, rob food, and abduct people. In order to avoid being robbed and becoming slaves of the pirates, the women and the elderly of the tribe had to take up arms to resist the pirates' invasion so that they could survive until the men who went out to work came back or reinforcements arrived. The harsh living environment determined the toughness of the women and children of Mepiah, but at this moment, it dealt a heavy blow to Shiloh.

The left wing of Mepiah became stronger because of their arrival, the fighting spirit of the Mepiah warriors was reawakened by their shouts, and the front line was stabilized.

The Poseidonian soldiers had been exhausted from the continuous fierce attack. Just when they were about to defeat the enemy, an accident occurred, which was a blow to their soldiers. They wanted to attack again, but they were already unable to do so. The offensive gradually slowed down, and the two sides were in a stalemate again.

When arranging the battle formation, Xi Luo saw that most of the families of Meipiah were concentrated on both sides behind the center, and he felt a little strange. Now he understood: at that time, the Meipiah people had decided to use them to help defend Meipiah's left wing in an emergency! (To be continued. Chapter 179:
Volume 3, Chapter 101: Battle of Bruttiia (V) - From City-State to Empire

"It would be great if the women of the Brutti could be like this!" Hero looked ahead at the left wing: the Brutti formation had not moved forward for such a long time since it arrived there. According to the riders' report, 'the two sides were deadlocked.' But the Brutti Alliance had 500 warriors! Even if it was a draw, it would still be a failure.

Shiloh looked to the right again: the arc-shaped line was gradually becoming straight. Shiloh was not worried. He believed that as long as his soldiers recovered from this and continued to attack the enemy fiercely, it would only be a matter of time before the right wing won.

But time is precious to Shiloh!

At this time, the battle had lasted for about half an hour.

He didn't know whether the left-wing Brutti Alliance could continue to hold on, and he couldn't control it (even Strom couldn't control it, let alone him).

He was already surprised that the slave phalanx in the middle could hold out on the defense for such a long time, but it was wishful thinking for him to attack and repel the enemy.

Right wing! Only the right wing! He always believed in and relied on those Poseidon soldiers who trained with him day after day and fought bloody battles with him many times!

Shiloh turned around suddenly. On his side were a cavalry squad of about 60 people and a Worm squad of 56 people. He used the cavalry squad for reconnaissance and message delivery. He originally wanted to use the Worm squad to temporarily push forward and resist when the middle road was a little unstable. Now it seemed that he had to change his plan. One hundred and sixteen people were so insignificant in this great battle, but if used properly, it might be the last straw that broke the camel's back!

Stuart snorted and came in front of the two phalanxes in a few steps.

"Soldiers!" Shiloh said bluntly, "The battle has reached a critical moment! I want you to follow me and attack the enemy! This attack will determine the outcome of this battle!!"

As soon as the voice fell, the Worm squad became excited, they had been waiting for this moment for a long time. The cavalry squad was also excited, since their establishment, they had undergone hard training like other soldiers, but when it came to fighting, they were just running errands, and now they finally had the chance to prove themselves.

Shiloh saw this and nodded secretly in his heart: the morale is good.

"Larka, recall your soldiers immediately! Kozula, go tell Secito to do everything he can to defend the center for me!" Shilo knew that if he led the team away from the center, it would definitely have a negative impact on the slaves. He could only pin his hopes on Secito. The longer he could hold on, the more chances Poseidon would have of winning.

"One rider and one Volm, two people on one horse, follow me!" Shiloh immediately gave the order when he saw that everyone had arrived. It was actually a bit difficult for a horse without a saddle to carry two people. Fortunately, this was only a short distance.

Shiloh took the lead, and everyone followed closely behind. The entire right wing's diagonal line was about a mile long, and it only took a few minutes to ride on horseback, but at this moment Shiloh wished he could go around to the rear and launch an attack immediately.

Just as he was galloping, a roar like a tsunami came from behind him. His heart tightened, and he wanted to look back to see what happened, but he suppressed the impulse. At this critical moment, he could only move forward, not backward!

"Forward! Victory is just ahead!!" He raised his right fist and shouted loudly. His confident and resolute voice dispelled the anxiety in the soldiers' hearts and made them clamp their horses' bellies more forcefully so as to keep up with the king who could constantly create miracles.

…

The great noise came from the left.

Although the Brutti were caught off guard by Shakel's strange tactics at the beginning and were in a passive position, compared to the Boserais, they had a blood feud with Mephia that destroyed their families and clans. Therefore, in the fight, the Brutti were not only brave, but also more brutal: when they were stabbed by the enemy, they would grab the spear shaft with their hands and then stab the opponent with the spear; if the spear broke, they would use their fists, hit the enemy with their foreheads, or even bite with their teeth;

The performance of the Mepia warriors was equally impressive, but the difference in numbers caused the two wings of the Mepia right wing to be gradually weakened. If it were not for the participation of the Mepia women and children, the Mepia people on both sides would probably have been defeated.

But in the center, the Brutti were struggling. Shaker's warriors used a different tactic from Meppia: swinging a spear requires space, but Shaker's warriors stuck close to the enemy opposite, making it impossible for the enemy to exert force, and thus unable to fully exert the power of the spear, while their short swords could stab and stab in the gaps. The Brutti warriors were not equipped with short swords like the soldiers of Poseidon, because they lacked iron and were not as rich as Poseidon (the same was true for Meppia, but Shaker's tribe had accumulated a lot of wealth through long-term looting). Even if they wanted to die together, they could not grab the sharp short swords. The Brutti in the center suffered heavy casualties, but they were struggling to hold on.

"Brothers!!" Shaker always yelled during breaks in battle.

"Hey!!" His warriors would immediately shout in response.

Through the roars, Shaker would judge the casualties of the soldiers. As the battle continued, the soldiers' responses became smaller and smaller, which made Shaker irritated. The tenacity of the Brutti was beyond his imagination. If he could not break through the enemy's defense line, this would probably be his burial place.

"Come closer to me! Come closer to me!!..." Shaker shouted hoarsely. Through the spread of his companions, the warriors heard the leader's order and they tried to move towards Shaker.

Shaker used himself as the tip of the arrow, gathered his warriors to form the arrowhead, and launched another fierce attack on the enemy. When the arrow broke through layers of obstacles and was about to run out of power and fall deep into the center of the Brutti formation, an accident happened - they encountered the Kuram people.

Strom and some leaders of the alliance were dissatisfied with Thor's initiative to approach Poseidon. At the same time, they despised the Kulm people for their fear of death. Therefore, they unanimously decided to arrange more than 100 Kulm warriors in the center of the square when arranging the battle array, so that the Kulm people could not sneak away.

Of course, the Kulms knew that this was a battle that would decide the fate of Brutti, and they wanted to fight bravely. However, when the bloody Mepea warriors appeared before them, the fear they had accumulated from years of running away immediately broke out in their bodies: they screamed, turned around and ran, completely ignoring the attempts of their leader Thor to stop them. Unfortunately, the Brutti's formation was loose, and they could not stop their escape.

Seeing this, Shakur was overjoyed and immediately shouted, "Drive them away!!"

The warriors understood what he meant. They used to use this technique to drive away the pirates and find their nests. Now they just switched from the sea to the land. They roared even louder and stabbed the fleeing Kulm people with their daggers instead of killing them. (To be continued. Chapter 180:
Volume 3, Chapter 102: Battle of Bruttiia (VI) - From City-State to Empire

Under the dual stimulation of fear and pain, the Kulm people fled desperately and even shouted, "Help!" If anyone tried to stop them, the Mepia warriors would quickly pounce on them and kill them.

The central part of the Brutti was unable to organize effectively to stop the Mepeans because the Kulms were running around like headless flies. The Brutti in the rear were determined to fight to the death. If one person ran past them in panic, they might not be affected, but if two, three, four people ran away from them, they would inevitably panic. Since they were in the center of the battle, they could not understand the overall situation, and they would wonder: Did the front lose? At this time, the shadow of the previous defeat by the Mepeans once again shrouded their hearts, causing their courage to gradually disappear.

Sadly, the Bruttii Alliance was a loose alliance without a strong, unified command system, and it had no effective measures to stop the spread of chaos. When the chaos expanded to a certain extent, the entire central part of the Bruttii array collapsed.

When hundreds of Brutti screamed in fear and turned to flee, it had a great impact on the two sides that still had the upper hand. They also retreated after a short while. The entire left wing of the Poseidon-Brutti coalition was like a frightened flock of sheep, fleeing for their lives.

All the Mepia warriors need to do is to chase closely and not give the enemy any chance to regroup.

When the fleeing Brutti people saw the dense crowd ahead, a glimmer of clarity was finally injected into their confused minds: Our families are right ahead!

However, it was too late. The high-spirited Mepia warriors drove them into the huge lineup full of old men, women and children.

A huge noise accompanied by a greater commotion was heard, which was the painful wailing of countless old people, women and children...

…

As soon as Shiloh bypassed the right wing, he reined in his horse not far behind the enemy.

He jumped off his horse and the guards immediately handed him shield and spear.

After he took it, he said to the flag bearer behind him: "Give the royal flag to Kozula, and you charge with me!"

The flag bearer could not hide the excitement on his face. It was a great honor to be a flag bearer, and it was held by warriors who had made military achievements. However, once they were in the position, they could not go into battle to kill the enemy unless they were rotated.

Because of the small number of soldiers, Shilo had no choice but to let the weak Kozula serve as the flag bearer. Every bit of combat power counts.

"Follow me, hold the flag high, and never let it fall. Can you do it?!" Shilo stared at Kozura, and his words were like iron nails, hitting Kozura's head one word at a time.

Kozula looked solemn but calm: "I am not afraid to follow the king. As long as the flag is alive, the people will be alive. If the flag is gone, the people will die!"

Shiloh nodded, turned around and glanced at the soldiers who had lined up, raised his spear, and shouted, "Follow me!!"

He took a big step forward like a lion, and amid the shouts of the soldiers, he charged directly into the rear of Meppia's left wing.

Two old Mepea men were knocked away. He pierced a Mepea woman's chest with his spear, but he couldn't pull it out because he used too much force. He calmly used his round shield to block the spear of another woman next to him, and drew out his dagger to cut off half of her head. In a war of life and death, there was no mercy in Hero's eyes. Anyone who threatened his survival was his enemy!

Since the beginning of the battle, the two teams, who had been holding back for a long time, pounced on the enemy like hungry wolves. Unfortunately, the enemies they faced were mostly the elderly, the weak, women and children, and their killing power was not strong. In a blink of an eye, dozens of people were killed and injured like cutting melons and vegetables, causing panic.

This change was quickly noticed by the two parties fighting at the rear end of the array.

"It's the King! It's the King!" The axemen saw a silver flag suddenly rising behind the enemy, with the silver image of a dolphin on top of the flag shining brightly, and they all shouted in excitement.

Anchialou was greatly encouraged: "Brothers, attack fiercely!!"

The tired bodies of Zhan Qi's soldiers seemed to be re-injected with strength. They raised their already heavy axes and smashed them heavily at the enemy.

The harpoon warriors, with a strong desire to avenge their leader Faka and the help of the Mepiah tribe, were able to hold off the attack of the battle axe soldiers, and were now exhausted. The flanks and rear were suddenly attacked, and the battle axe soldiers launched a fierce attack at the same time. Hearing the screams of the tribesmen behind them, the harpoon warriors' desire to defend quickly faded away, leaving only one thought: Run!

Shiloh met up with Anchialo, and Shiloh's initial attack plan was finally realized after half an hour. However, was it still too late?

…

The departure of King Poseidon and the great retreat of the left wing made the slaves in the middle panic. In addition, the enemy on the opposite side also took the opportunity to intensify the attack. The slave phalanx began to retreat and some began to attempt to escape. The military law team slaughtered several slaves in a row, but still could not stop the decline.

The phalanx began to disintegrate, and the retreating slaves had already clashed with the military law enforcement team. It seemed that another major rout was about to take place.

At this moment, a loud song came from the back of the square: "Long live the Nile!

You appeared on this earth, came peacefully, and gave life to Egypt!

O Amun, you lead the night into the day, and your guidance brings joy to mankind!

The garden was created by Ra..."

Because Egyptians are hardworking, good at growing wheat, raising livestock, and relatively docile, they are the best candidates for slaves. During the Persian rule of Egypt, the nobles annexed land and exploited farmers, causing a large number of Egyptian civilians to flee, but they were captured as slaves by the Persian nobles, which became another way for them to make money. Most of Poseidon's slaves were Egyptians. Although the price was expensive, it was really worth the money. These Egyptian slaves who were numb to life suddenly heard the songs of their hometown, like a spring of sweet water re-irrigating their dry hearts. They listened to the songs blankly, tears streaming down their faces, trembling their lips, and chanted the most famous Nile hymn in Egypt: "Give life to all animals, and irrigate the earth without stopping..."

Soon, the sound of fighting on the battlefield was drowned out by this solemn and slightly sentimental song. However, the slave phalanx retreated faster. Obviously, the song aroused the homesickness of all the Egyptian slaves.

Secito frowned in the back: Now it has come to a critical moment, I hope the king's arrangement will work: "Raise the flag!!"

A large flag was hoisted high. On it was not Poseidon's flag, but a statue of an Egyptian pharaoh holding a scepter and a flail and wearing a false beard. The guards, composed of dozens of Egyptian slaves selected by Hiro from the slave soldiers, shouted in Egyptian: "Osiris, bless us in our fight for freedom! Osiris..."

"It's Osiris! Osiris!!..." When the Egyptian slaves saw the statue suddenly standing in the air, they stopped and shouted incoherently.

"Charge!" Secito rushed forward without hesitation, holding a spear in his hand. The guards held up the statue of Osiris and followed closely. They passed through the scattered slave phalanx and met the aggressive Mepiah army with their small number.

The slaves turned their heads and looked at the statue of Osiris swaying back and forth in the air, in danger of falling down at any time, and their mood suddenly became extremely anxious.

"For the god Osiris!!" When one slave finally couldn't bear it anymore and attacked the enemy again, the other slaves also rushed towards Sesito.

As the king of the underworld, the god of resurrection, the god of abundance and the giver of civilization, Osiris is one of the most revered gods by the Egyptians! In the eyes of the Egyptian slaves who were far away from their homeland and experienced hardships, this flag is not just a symbol, it is Egypt! It is hope! Under the protection of Osiris, the Egyptians are not afraid of death! !

The slave phalanx spontaneously launched the only and most fierce attack since the war began, and actually forced the Mepeans' center to retreat again and again.

Hammock, who was in the array, was greatly shocked. He saw the towering statue of Osiris in front of him and immediately shouted, "Destroy it! Destroy that statue!!"

The order was passed on by word of mouth, and dozens of spears stabbed at Sesito and his guards at the same time, while the slaves tried their best to stop them, as they would never let their gods be blasphemed.

Even when Shakel arrived with a few soldiers and attacked the flank of the center, the slave phalanx was not shaken, because the towering Osiris that was always moving forward was the fertile land in their hearts! A paradise of death and resurrection!

…

Shiloh and his more than one hundred soldiers were like small stones on the top of a snowy mountain. They killed a group of enemies, gathered in a small square, killed another group of enemies, and gathered in another small square...

The little stone rolled bigger and faster...

The left wing of the Mepeans completely collapsed, and then Shilo led his twenty-nine small phalanxes to roll back to the center like a long steel dragon, intending to devour all the enemies in the center!

"Retreat! Retreat! Chief!..." the elders shouted in fear.

Hammock looked at the scattered tribesmen, dumbfounded, with tears streaming down his face...

…

Before the rout spread to the right flank, Shaker withdrew from the battle in time. He had to save his soldiers who were still looting.

He even felt a little regretful: because his tribe was plundering by nature, they relapsed into bad habits after defeating the Brutti, and did not respond to his call in time. If he could bring more warriors, perhaps it would be hard to say who would win or lose...

…

When Poseidon's soldiers were chasing the fleeing soldiers, Hero came to the statue of Osiris: Sesito, the commander of the central route of the Poseidon-Brutti alliance, had exceeded the task assigned to him by King Poseidon. At the most critical moment, it was he who led the troops, stood at the front of the battle line, boosted morale, defended the central route, and launched a counterattack. However, when victory came, he fell down with more than ten wounds on his body, the most serious of which was a spear that went through the gap between the bronze armor and pierced his abdomen from his ribs...

Xi Luo stood in front of his body, staring at the gray-black face that was once very familiar but now seemed a little strange. His words from last night seemed to echo in his ears: "A true king is fearless!..."

After standing there for a moment, Xi Luo leaned down and gently covered his angry eyes with his hands...

He stood up. The sun above his head was emitting scorching rays, and the strong south wind blowing from the Mediterranean Sea, passing over the towering holy mountain, mixed with the cries of the Brutti women and the sounds of the soldiers chasing and killing, blowing on the blood-soaked armor of Heron, it was surprisingly cool...

He raised his sword, and cheers of "Victory!!!" rang out all over the battlefield... (To be continued. ) (To be continued)
